doc:
Evelyn Ellis https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evelyn_Ellis 0 Evelyn Ellis (February 2, 1894 – June 5, 1958) was an American character actress of stage and film. Devoting herself to the theatre, her film roles were few, but she appeared in films including The Joe Louis Story and The Lady from Shanghai. Towards the end of her career, Miss Ellis, as she was called, also directed a few theater plays. The Baltimore Afro American newspaper in its issue in October 26, 1929, described her as a “quiet and unassuming young lady with a very charming personality". An attractive woman who could have been a leading lady, she chose character roles. Evelyn_Ellis ( February_2_,_1894 – June_5_,_1958 ) was an_American_character_actress of stage_and_film . Devoting herself to the_theatre , her_film_roles were few , but she appeared in films including The_Joe_Louis_Story and The_Lady from Shanghai . Towards the_end of her_career , Miss_Ellis , as she was_called , also directed a_few_theater plays . The_Baltimore_Afro_American_newspaper in its_issue in October_26_,_1929 , described her as a_“_quiet_and_unassuming_young_lady with a_very_charming_personality_" . An_attractive_woman who could_have_been a_leading_lady , she chose character_roles .
